content: corner­to­corner baby blanket pattern i used hobby lobby i love this yarn in navy grey mist and white on this blanket materials ­ yarn ­ 3­4 skeins hook ­ h/5 00 yarn needle for weaving in ends abbreviations ­ chain ­ chain double_crochet ­ double_crochet slip_stitch ­ slip_stitch single_crochet ­ single_crochet this is a simple corner­2­corner pattern with a simple scalloped border i did 6 row of each color repetitively when i got to the middle stripe i did 7 row of gray so that it would look even and then went back to 6 row of each color so it went like this increasing 6 row of gray 6 of white 6 of navy 6 of gray 6 of white 6 of navy 4 of gray decreasing 3 row of gray 6 of white 6 of navy 6 of gray 6 of white 6 of navy 6 of gray chain 6 row 1 double_crochet in the 4th chain from hook and in the next 2 chain; turn ­ 1 block row 2 chain 6 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook and in the next 2 chain ­ slip_stitch into the chain 3 space of previous row chain 3 and 3 double_crochet all in the chain 3 space of previous row; turn ­ 2 blocks made row 3 chain 6 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook and in the next 2 chain ­ slip_stitch into chain 3 space of previous row chain 3 and 3 double_crochet all in the chain 3 space of previous row 2 times to give you 3 blocks continue this pattern ­ adding 1 block per row for row 4 to row 40 i did 40 row and then started decreasing on row 41 * decrease * row 41 after turning slip_stitch across each double_crochet slip_stitch into chain 3 space of previous row chain 3 3 double_crochet into the chain 3 from previous row slip_stitch into ch3 of previous row turn ***repeat row 41 for row 42 to row 79 fasten_off * scalloped border * be sure and do 3 stitches whether double_crochet or single_crochet into the corners row 1 single_crochet all the way around doing only 2 single_crochet per square otherwise it might ripple slip_stitch to the beginning single_crochet row 2 chain 3 and then double_crochet in each single_crochet slip_stitch to the top chain of the ch3 row 3 without chaining skip the first stitch of the row and work 5 double_crochet into the next stitch skip 1 stitch slip_stitch into the next stitch the slip_stitch anchors the scallop skip the next stitch and then work 5 double_crochet into the next stitch so it s 5 double_crochet skip stitch slip_stitch skip stitch 5 double_crochet etc all the way around **** as you get closer to the end you may have to not skip some stitches to make it evenish just do what looks good to you if you find any errors in this please let me know thanks kindra s crochet
